newsitem.title: USA: MCI files shelf for $1 billion in notes.
newsitem.headline: MCI files shelf for $1 billion in notes.

text.p: MCI Communications Corp filed Friday with the Securities and Exchange Commission a shelf registration for up to $1 billion in senior/subordinated medium-term notes.
The telecommunication company said the notes are due nine months or more from date of issue.
The notes are being offered through Bear Stearns & Co Inc, Citicorp Securities Inc, Merrill Lynch & Co and J.P. Morgan Securities Inc, the filing said.

Proceeds from the offering will be added to MCI's general corporate funds and will be used for general corporate purposes. Until used, the net proceeds will be invested in income-producing securities, the filing said.
